column4: k3b and gnomebaker won't burn cds they say that they don't have "permission to open the device" any ideas?
you need to use gksudo/sudo
K3b and gnomebaker are guis though
right...so do <alt>F2 gksudo K3b enter
though in my experience you need to do sudo from a terminal for gnomebaker to work (maybe it's just me)
np
it's not executing k3b :( do I have to type "enter" ?
yup
i mean, hit the enter key
oh...well neither gksudo or sudo K3b works
does it need to be a lowercase k?
oh, duh. I'm an idiot. That did it. thanks
well, i'm the one who gave you the command. lol
It is burning!!!! YOU ROCK!
you would've figured it out, but thanks!
is it a new file?
no, it's been on the comp for at least a day or two
hmm...try the "locate" command in a terminal
sweet! what does /|\ mean?
do you know why the gui isn't finding the files?
no idea--i just use locate and avoid unnecessary complications when possible.
soory
go to #automatix
